comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Florence Jaffray "Daisy" Harriman (July 21, 1870 – August 31, 1967) was an American socialite, suffragist, social reformer, organizer, and diplomat. Jefferson Borden Harriman (September 20, 1864-December 2, 1914) was a New York financier and member of the Gilded Age’s “hunting set.” They had one child, Ethel M.B. Harriman, born on December 11, 1897. Ethel worked on Broadway and in Hollywood, as an actress and writer (as Ethel Russell or Ethel Borden). Variant picture: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5963838071/]

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content:
Repeat appearance on Flickr, for instance her portrait here:

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The photo above and its companion were taken on August 29, 1914. Perhaps the Harrimans were in New York City for the Woman's Peace Parade, held that day.

Another Bain photo, from August 20, 1912, shows Daisy Harriman (Mrs. Borden Harriman) at a Woodrow Wilson campaign rally in New York City's Union Square, tossing campaign buttons into the crowd:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2368281179/]
